On a hit, the attack deals Radiant damage equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Chalice
entries: A constellation of a life-giving goblet appears on you. Whenever you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores Hit Points to a creature, you or another creature within 30 feet of you can regain Hit Points equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Dragon
entries: A constellation of a wise dragon appears on you. When you make an Intelligence or a Wisdom check or a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status Concentration}, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Omen
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can consult your Star Map for omens and roll a die. Until you finish your next {@rule Long Rest}, you gain access to a special {@rule Reaction} based on whether you rolled an even or an odd number on the die:

items.name: Weal (even)
entries: Whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is about to make a {@rule D20 Test}, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to roll 1d6 and add the number rolled to the total.

items.name: Woe (odd)
entries: Whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is about to make a {@rule D20 Test}, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to roll 1d6 and subtract the number rolled from the total.
You can use this {@rule Reaction} a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Twinkling Constellations
entries: The constellations of your Starry Form improve. The 1d8 of the Archer and the Chalice becomes 2d8, and while the Dragon is active, you have a {@rule Fly Speed} of 20 feet and can hover.
Moreover, at the start of each of your turns while in your Starry Form, you can change which constellation glimmers on your body.

subclassFeature.name: Full of Stars
entries: While in your Starry Form, you become partially incorporeal, giving you {@rule Resistance} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

fluff.name: Fighter
entries: Highly trained warriors defined by their martial prowess and battlefield command abilities. They hone their skills to stand head and shoulders above others on the field of battle.

{@i Choose A, B, or C:} (A) {@item Chain Mail}, {@item Greatsword}, {@item Flail}, 8 {@item Javelin|Javelins}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack}, and 4 GP; (B) {@item Studded Leather Armor}, {@item Scimitar}, {@item Shortsword}, {@item Longbow}, {@item Arrows (20)|20 Arrows}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack}, and 11 GP; or (C) 155 GP

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You have honed your martial prowess and gain a Fighting Style option of your choice. Defense is recommended.
Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace the feat you chose with a different Fighting Style option.

classFeature.name: Second Wind
entries: You have a limited well of physical and mental stamina that you can draw on. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can use it to regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 plus your Fighter level.
You can use this feature twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain more uses of this feature, as shown in the Second Wind column of the Fighter Features table.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can practice weapon drills and change one of those weapon choices.
When you reach certain Fighter levels, you gain the ability to use the mastery properties of more kinds of weapons, as shown in the {@rule Weapon} Mastery column of the Fighter Features table.

classFeature.name: Action Surge
entries: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action, except the {@action Magic} action.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest. Starting at level 17, you can use it twice before a rest but only once on a turn.

classFeature.name: Tactical Mind
entries: You have a mind for tactics on and off the battlefield. When you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of your Second Wind to push yourself toward success. Rather than regaining Hit Points, you roll 1d10 and add the number rolled to the ability check, potentially turning it into a success. If the check still fails, this use of Second Wind isn't expended.

classFeature.name: Fighter Subclass
entries: You gain a Fighter subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Fighter levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Fighter level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Fighter levels 6, 8, 12, 14, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Tactical Shift
entries: Whenever you activate your Second Wind with a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can move up to half your {@rule Speed} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Fighter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Indomitable
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Fighter level. You must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
You can use this feature twice before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 13 and three times before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 17.

classFeature.name: Tactical Master
entries: When you attack with a weapon whose mastery property you can use, you can replace that property with the {@itemMastery Push}, {@itemMastery Sap}, or {@itemMastery Slow} property for that attack.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Fighter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Two Extra Attacks
entries: You can attack three times instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Indomitable
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Fighter level. You must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
You can use this feature twice before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 13 and three times before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 17.

classFeature.name: Studied Attacks
entries: You study your opponents and learn from each attack you make. If you make an attack roll against a creature and miss, you have {@rule Advantage} on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Fighter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest. Starting at level 17, you can use it twice before a rest but only once on a turn.

classFeature.name: Indomitable
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can reroll it with a bonus equal to your Fighter level. You must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
You can use this feature twice before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 13 and three times before a {@rule Long Rest} starting at level 17.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Fighter Subclass.

classFeature.name: Three Extra Attacks
entries: You can attack four times instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Master
entries: {@i Master Sophisticated Battle Maneuvers}

Battle Masters are students of the art of battle, learning martial techniques passed down through generations. The most accomplished Battle Masters are well-rounded figures who combine their carefully honed combat skills with academic study in the fields of history, theory, and the arts.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: Your experience on the battlefield has refined your fighting techniques. You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called Superiority Dice.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You learn three maneuvers of your choice from the Maneuvers section. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice when you reach Fighter levels 7, 10, and 15. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four Superiority Dice, which are {@dice d8|d8s}. A Superiority Die is expended when you use it. You regain all expended Superiority Dice when you finish a Short or Long Rest.
You gain an additional Superiority Die when you reach Fighter levels 7 (five dice total) and 15 (six dice total).

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a maneuver requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Student of War
entries: You gain proficiency with one type of {@item Artisan's Tools} of your choice, and you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice from the skills available to Fighters at level 1.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can discern certain strengths and weaknesses of a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself; you know whether that creature has any Immunities, Resistances, or Vulnerabilities, and if the creature has any, you know what they are.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You can also restore a use of the feature by expending one Superiority Die (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Improved Combat Superiority
entries: Your Superiority Die becomes a d10.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: Once per turn, when you use a maneuver, you can roll 1d8 and use the number rolled instead of expending a Superiority Die.

subclassFeature.name: Ultimate Combat Superiority
entries: Your Superiority Die becomes a d12.

subclassFeature.name: Champion
entries: {@i Pursue Physical Excellence in Combat}

A Champion focuses on the development of martial prowess in a relentless pursuit of victory. Champions combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows, withstand peril, and garner glory. Whether in athletic contests or bloody battle, Champions strive for the crown of the victor.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Critical
entries: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can score a {@rule Critical Hit} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: Thanks to your athleticism, you have {@rule Advantage} on {@rule Initiative} rolls and Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.
In addition, immediately after you score a {@rule Critical Hit}, you can move up to half your {@rule Speed} without provoking {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: You gain another Fighting Style option of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Warrior
entries: The thrill of battle drives you toward victory. During combat, you can give yourself {@rule Heroic Inspiration} whenever you start your turn without it.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Critical
entries: Your attack rolls with weapons and Unarmed Strikes can now score a {@rule Critical Hit} on a roll of 18–20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Survivor
entries: You attain the pinnacle of resilience in battle, giving you these benefits.

entries.name: Defy Death
entries: You have {@rule Advantage} on Death Saving Throws. Moreover, when you roll 18–20 on a {@rule Death Saving Throw}, you gain the benefit of rolling a 20 on it.

entries.name: Heroic Rally
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain Hit Points equal to 5 plus your Constitution modifier if you are {@rule Bloodied} and have at least 1 {@rule Hit Points|Hit Point}.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Knight
entries: {@i Support Combat Skills with Arcane Magic}

Eldritch Knights combine the martial mastery common to all Fighters with a careful study of magic. Their spells both complement and extend their combat skills, providing additional protection to shore up their armor and also allowing them to engage many foes at once with explosive magic.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules as an Eldritch Knight.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the {@spells ?spell-class-filter=wizard|Wizard spell list}. Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list.
{@spell Blade Ward} and {@spell True Strike} are recommended.
When you reach Fighter level 10, you learn another Wizard cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the Wizard spell list. {@spell Find Familiar}, {@spell Burning Hands}, and {@spell Shield} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Fighter levels, as shown in the Spells column of the Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the Wizard spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Fighter, your list of prepared spells can include five Wizard spells of levels 1 and 2 in any combination.

entries.name: Changing your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Wizard spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Wizard spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus} as a {@rule Spellcasting Focus} for your Wizard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Bond
entries: You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a {@rule Short Rest}. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch the weapon and forge the bond. The bond fails if another Fighter is bonded to the weapon or if the weapon is a magic item to which someone else is attuned.

Once you have bonded a weapon to yourself, you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition. If it is on the same plane of existence, you can summon that weapon as a {@rule Bonus Action}, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

You can have up to two bonded weapons, but you can summon only one at a time with a {@rule Bonus Action}. If you attempt to bond with a third weapon, you must break the bond with one of the other two.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with a casting of one of your Wizard cantrips that has a casting time of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: You learn how to make your weapon strikes undercut a creature's ability to withstand your spells. When you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, that creature has {@rule Disadvantage} on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Charge
entries: When you use your {@rule Action} Surge, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can teleport before or after the additional action.

subclassFeature.name: Improved War Magic
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can replace two of the attacks with a casting of one of your level 1 or level 2 Wizard spells that has a casting time of an action.

subclassFeature.name: Psi Warrior
entries: {@i Augment Physical Might with Psionic Power}

Psi Warriors awaken the power of their minds to augment their physical might. They harness this psionic power to infuse their weapon strikes, lash out with telekinetic energy, and create barriers of mental force.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Power
entries: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. It is represented by your Psionic Energy Dice, which fuel powers you have from this subclass. The Psi Warrior Energy Dice table shows the die size and number of these dice you have when you reach certain Fighter levels.

Any features in this subclass that use a Psionic Energy Die use only the dice from this subclass. Some of your powers expend the Psionic Energy Die, as specified in a power's description, and you can't use a power if it requires you to use a die when all your Psionic Energy Dice are expended.
You regain one of your expended Psionic Energy Dice when you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, and you regain all of them when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Protective Field
entries: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to expend one Psionic Energy Die, roll the die, and reduce the damage taken by the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum reduction of 1), as you create a momentary shield of telekinetic force.

entries.name: Psionic Strike
entries: You can propel your weapons with psionic force. Once on each of your turns, immediately after you hit a target within 30 feet of yourself with an attack and deal damage to it with a weapon, you can expend one Psionic Energy Die, rolling it and dealing Force damage to the target equal to the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Telekinetic Movement
entries: You can move an object or a creature with your mind. As a {@action Magic} action, choose one target you can see within 30 feet of yourself; the target must be a loose object that is Large or smaller or one willing creature other than you. You transport the target up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Alternatively, if the target is a Tiny object, you can transport it to or from your hand.
Once you take this action, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Adept
entries: You have mastered new ways to use your telekinetic abilities, detailed below.

entries.name: Psi-Powered Leap
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you gain a {@rule Fly Speed} equal to twice your {@rule Speed} until the end of the current turn. Once you take this {@rule Bonus Action}, you can't do so again until you finish a Short or Long Rest unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

entries.name: Telekinetic Thrust
entries: When you deal damage to a target with your Psionic Strike, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus). On a failed save, you can give the target the {@condition Prone} condition or transport it up to 10 feet horizontally.

subclassFeature.name: Guarded Mind
entries: You have {@rule Resistance} to Psychic damage. Moreover, if you start your turn with the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition, you can expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) and end every effect on yourself giving you those conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Bulwark of Force
entries: You can shield yourself and others with telekinetic force. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can choose creatures, including yourself, within 30 feet of yourself, up to a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one creature). Each of the chosen creatures has {@rule Cover|Half Cover} for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest} unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Master
entries: You always have the {@spell Telekinesis} spell prepared. With this feature, you can cast it without a spell slot or components, and your spellcasting ability for it is Intelligence. On each of your turns while you maintain {@status Concentration} on it, including the turn when you cast it, you can make one attack with a weapon as a {@rule Bonus Action}.

Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest} unless you expend a Psionic Energy Die (no action required) to restore your use of it.

fluff.name: Monk
entries: Specialized warriors defined by their unique combat style and their reserve of internal power called ki. They use this ki to empower their attacks, bolster their defense, and create spell-like effects.

weapons: Martial weapons that have the Light property
tools: Choose one type of {@item Artisan's Tools} or {@item Musical Instrument}

classFeature.name: Martial Arts
entries: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use your {@rule Unarmed Strike} and Monk weapons, which are the following:

items: Martial Weapons that have the Light property

entries: You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only Monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield}.

entries.name: Bonus Unarmed Strike
entries: You can make an {@rule Unarmed Strike} as a {@rule Bonus Action}.

entries.name: Martial Arts Die
entries: You can roll 1d6 in place of the normal damage of your {@rule Unarmed Strike} or Monk weapons. This die changes as you gain Monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk Features table.

entries.name: Dexterous Attacks
entries: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes and Monk weapons. In addition, when you use the Grapple or Shove option of your {@rule Unarmed Strike}, you can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier to determine the save DC.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield}, your base {@rule Armor Class} equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers.

classFeature.name: Monk's Focus
entries: Your focus and martial training allow you to harness a well of extraordinary energy within yourself. This energy is represented by Focus Points. Your Monk level determines the number of points you have, as shown in the Focus Points column of the Monk Features table.
You can expend these points to enhance or fuel certain Monk features. You start knowing three such features: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind, each of which is detailed below.
When you expend a Focus Point, it is unavailable until you finish a Short or Long Rest, at the end of which you regain all your expended points.
Some features that use Focus Points require your target to make a saving throw. The save DC equals 8 plus your Wisdom modifier and {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

entries.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: You can expend 1 Focus Point to make two Unarmed Strikes as a {@rule Bonus Action}.

entries.name: Patient Defense
entries: You can take the {@action Disengage} action as a {@rule Bonus Action}. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the {@action Disengage} and the {@action Dodge} actions as a {@rule Bonus Action}.

entries.name: Step of the Wind
entries: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a {@rule Bonus Action}. Alternatively, you can expend 1 Focus Point to take both the {@action Disengage} and {@action Dash} actions as a {@rule Bonus Action}, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield}. This bonus increases when you reach certain Monk levels, as shown on the Monk Features table.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Metabolism
entries: When you roll {@rule Initiative}, you can regain all expended Focus Points. When you do so, roll your Martial Arts die, and regain a number of Hit Points equal to your Monk level plus the number rolled.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

classFeature.name: Deflect Attacks
entries: When an attack roll hits you and its damage includes Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to reduce the attack's total damage against you. The reduction equals 1d10 plus your Dexterity modifier and Monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can expend 1 Focus Point to redirect some of the attack's force. If you do so, choose a creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself if the attack was a melee attack or a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself that isn't behind {@rule Cover|Total Cover} if the attack was a ranged attack. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die plus your Dexterity modifier. The damage is the same type dealt by the attack.

classFeature.name: Monk Subclass
entries: You gain a Monk subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Monk levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Monk level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Monk levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Slow Fall
entries: You can take a {@rule Reaction} when you fall to reduce any damage you take from the fall by an amount equal to five times your Monk level.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Stunning Strike
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a Monk weapon or an {@rule Unarmed Strike}, you can expend 1 Focus Point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition Stunned} condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target's {@rule Speed} is halved until the start of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against the target before then has {@rule Advantage}.

classFeature.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: Whenever you deal damage with your {@rule Unarmed Strike}, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monk subclass.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: When you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if you fail.
You don't benefit from this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Acrobatic Movement
entries: While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item Shield}, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the movement.

classFeature.name: Heightened Focus
entries: Your Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: You can expend 1 Focus Point to use Flurry of Blows and make three Unarmed Strikes with it instead of two.

entries.name: Patient Defense
entries: When you expend a Focus Point to use Patient Defense, you gain a number of {@rule Temporary Hit Points} equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die.

entries.name: Step of the Wind
entries: When you expend a Focus Point to use Step of the Wind, you can choose a willing creature within 5 feet of yourself that is Large or smaller. You move the creature with you until the end of your turn. The creature's movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}.

classFeature.name: Self-Restoration
entries: Through sheer force of will, you can remove one of the following conditions from yourself at the end of each of your turns: {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Frightened}, or {@condition Poisoned}.
In addition, forgoing food and drink doesn't give you levels of {@condition Exhaustion}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monk subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Deflect Energy
entries: You can now use your Deflect Attacks feature against attacks that deal any damage type, not just Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing.

classFeature.name: Disciplined Survivor
entries: Your physical and mental discipline grant you proficiency in all saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can expend 1 Focus Point to reroll it, and you must use the new roll.

classFeature.name: Perfect Focus
entries: When you roll {@rule Initiative} and don't use Uncanny Metabolism, you regain expended Focus Points until you have 4 if you have 3 or fewer.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Monk subclass.

classFeature.name: Superior Defense
entries: At the start of your turn, you can expend 3 Focus Points to bolster yourself against harm for 1 minute or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition. During that time, you have {@rule Resistance} to all damage except Force damage.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@epic-boon Epic Boon} or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. {@epic-boon Boon of Irresistible Offense} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Body and Mind
entries: You have developed your body and mind to new heights. Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Elements
entries: {@i Wield Strikes and Bursts of Elemental Power}

Warriors of the Elements tap into the power of the Elemental Planes. Harnessing their supernatural focus, these Monks momentarily tame the energy of the Elemental Chaos to empower themselves in and out of battle.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: At the start of your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point to imbue yourself with elemental energy. The energy lasts for 10 minutes or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition. You gain the following benefits while this feature is active.

entries.name: Reach
entries: When you make an {@rule Unarmed Strike}, your reach is 10 feet greater than normal, as elemental energy extends from you.

entries.name: Elemental Strikes
entries: Whenever you hit with your {@rule Unarmed Strike}, you can cause it to deal your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage rather than its normal damage type. When you deal one of these types with it, you can also force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you can move the target up to 10 feet toward or away from you, as elemental energy swirls around it.

subclassFeature.name: Manipulate Elements
entries: You know the {@spell Elementalism} spell. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Burst
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can expend 2 Focus Points to cause elemental energy to burst in a 20-foot-radius {@rule Sphere} centered on a point within 120 feet of yourself. Choose a damage type: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

Each creature in the {@rule Sphere} must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage of the chosen type equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Stride of the Elements
entries: While your Elemental Attunement is active, you also have a {@rule Fly Speed} and a {@rule Swim Speed} equal to your {@rule Speed}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Epitome
entries: While your Elemental Attunement is active, you also gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain {@rule Resistance} to one of the following damage types of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. At the start of each of your turns, you can change this choice.

entries.name: Destructive Stride
entries: When you use your Step of the Wind, your {@rule Speed} increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn. For that duration, any creature of your choice takes damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die when you enter a space within 5 feet of it. The damage type is your choice of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

entries.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: Once on each of your turns, you can deal extra damage to a target equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die when you hit it with an {@rule Unarmed Strike}. The extra damage is the same type dealt by that strike.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Mercy
entries: {@i Manipulate Forces of Life and Death}

Warriors of Mercy manipulate the life force of others. These Monks are wandering physicians, but they bring a swift end to their enemies. They often wear masks, presenting themselves as faceless bringers of life and death.

subclassFeature.name: Hand of Harm
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an {@rule Unarmed Strike} and deal damage, you can expend 1 Focus Point to deal extra Necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Hand of Healing
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can expend 1 Focus Point to touch a creature and restore a number of Hit Points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Wisdom modifier. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the Unarmed Strikes with a use of this feature without expending a Focus Point for the healing.

subclassFeature.name: Implements of Mercy
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight} and {@skill Medicine} skills and proficiency with the {@item Herbalism Kit}.

subclassFeature.name: Physician's Touch
entries: Your Hand of Harm and Hand of Healing improve, as detailed below.

entries.name: Hand of Harm
entries: When you use Hand of Harm on a creature, you can also give that creature the {@condition Poisoned} condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Hand of Healing
entries: When you use Hand of Healing, you can also end one of the following conditions on the creature you heal: {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, {@condition Poisoned}, or {@condition Stunned}.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry of Healing and Harm
entries: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can replace each of the Unarmed Strikes with a use of Hand of Healing without expending Focus Points for the healing.

In addition, when you make an {@rule Unarmed Strike} with Flurry of Blows and deal damage, you can use Hand of Harm with that strike without expending a Focus Point for Hand of Harm. You can still use Hand of Harm only once per turn.
You can use these benefits a total number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Hand of Ultimate Mercy
entries: Your mastery of life energy opens the door to the ultimate mercy. As a {@action Magic} action, you can touch the corpse of a creature that died within the past 24 hours and expend 5 Focus Points. The creature then returns to life with a number of Hit Points equal to 4d10 plus your Wisdom modifier. If the creature died with any of the following conditions, the creature revives with the conditions removed: {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, {@condition Poisoned}, and {@condition Stunned}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Open Hand
entries: {@i Master Unarmed Combat Techniques}
Warriors of the Open Hand are masters of unarmed combat. They learn techniques to push and trip their opponents and manipulate their own energy to protect themselves from harm.

subclassFeature.name: Open Hand Technique
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following effects on that target.

entries.name: Addle
entries: The target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks} until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Push
entries: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

entries.name: Topple
entries: The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition Prone} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Wholeness of Body
entries: You gain the ability to heal yourself. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can roll your Martial Arts die. You regain a number of Hit Points equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 {@rule Hit Points|Hit Point} regained).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Fleet Step
entries: When you take a {@rule Bonus Action} other than Step of the Wind, you can also use Step of the Wind immediately after that {@rule Bonus Action}.

subclassFeature.name: Quivering Palm
entries: You gain the ability to set up lethal vibrations in someone's body. When you hit a creature with an {@rule Unarmed Strike}, you can expend 4 Focus Points to start these imperceptible vibrations, which last for a number of days equal to your Monk level. The vibrations are harmless unless you take an action to end them. Alternatively, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can forgo one of the attacks to end the vibrations. To end them, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you end them, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d12} Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can end the vibrations harmlessly (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Shadow
entries: {@i Harness Shadow Power for Stealth and Subterfuge}

Warriors of Shadow practice stealth and subterfuge, harnessing the power of the Shadowfell. They are at home in darkness, able to draw gloom around themselves to hide, leap from shadow to shadow, and take on a wraithlike form.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Arts
entries: You have learned to draw on the power of the Shadowfell, gaining the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkness
entries: You can expend 1 Focus Point to cast the {@spell Darkness} spell without spell components. You can see within the spell's area when you cast it with this feature. While the spell persists, you can move its area of {@rule Darkness} to a space within 60 feet of yourself at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet.

entries.name: Shadowy Figments
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion} spell. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Step
entries: While entirely within {@rule Dim Light} or {@rule Darkness}, you can use a {@rule Bonus Action} to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in {@rule Dim Light} or {@rule Darkness}. You then have {@rule Advantage} on the next melee attack you make before the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Shadow Step
entries: You can draw on your Shadowfell connection to empower your teleportation. When you use your Shadow Step, you can expend 1 Focus Point to remove the requirement that you must start and end in {@rule Dim Light} or {@rule Darkness} for that use of the feature. As part of this {@rule Bonus Action}, you can make an {@rule Unarmed Strike} immediately after you teleport.

subclassFeature.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: As a {@action Magic} action while entirely within {@rule Dim Light} or {@rule Darkness}, you can expend 3 Focus Points to shroud yourself with shadows for 1 minute, until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, or until you end your turn in {@rule Bright Light}. While shrouded by these shadows, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries: You have the {@condition Invisible} condition.

entries.name: Partially Incorporeal
entries: You can move through occupied spaces as if they were {@rule Difficult Terrain}. If you end your turn in such a space, you are shunted to the last unoccupied space you were in.

entries.name: Shadow Flurry
entries: You can use your Flurry of Blows without expending any Focus Points.

fluff.name: Paladin
entries: Divine warriors defined by their martial prowess and unbreakable oath. Paladins use their strength of devotion to power their attacks and serve a god according to their oath.
{@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Chain Mail}, {@item Shield}, {@item Longsword}, 6 {@item Javelin|Javelins}, {@item Holy Symbol}, {@item Priest's Pack}, and 9 GP; or (B) 150 GP

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to cast spells through prayer and meditation. The information below details how you use those rules with Paladin spells, which appear in the {@spells ?spell-class-filter=paladin|Paladin spell list}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Paladin Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Paladin spells. {@spell Shield of Faith} and {@spell Wrathful Smite} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Paladin levels, as shown in the Spells column of the Paladin Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Paladin spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Paladin Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Paladin, your list of prepared spells can include six Paladin spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Paladin feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Paladin spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Paladin spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Paladin spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Holy Symbol} as a {@rule Spellcasting Focus} for your Paladin spells.

classFeature.name: Lay on Hands
entries: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. With that pool, you can restore a total number of Hit Points equal to five times your Paladin level.

As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can touch a creature (which could be yourself) and draw power from the pool of healing to restore a number of Hit Points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool.
You can also expend 5 Hit Points from the pool of healing power to remove the {@condition Poisoned} condition from the creature; those points don't also restore Hit Points to the creature.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Longsword|Longswords} and {@item Javelin|Javelins}.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of {@item Halberd|Halberds} and {@item Flail|Flails}.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a Fighting Style option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Paladin's Smite
entries: You always have the {@spell Divine Smite} spell prepared. In addition, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@rule Long Rest} before you can cast it in this way again.

classFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You can channel divine energy directly from the Outer Planes, using it to fuel magical effects. You start with one such effect: Divine Sense, which is described below. Other Paladin features give additional Channel Divinity effect options. Each time you use this class's Channel Divinity, you choose which effect from this class to create.

You can use this class's Channel Divinity twice. You regain one of its expended uses when you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You gain an additional use when you reach Paladin level 11.
If a Channel Divinity effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals the spell save DC from this class's Spellcasting feature.

classFeature.name: Divine Sense
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can open your awareness to detect Celestials, Fiends, and Undead. For the next 10 minutes or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, you know the location of any creature of those types within 60 feet of yourself, and you know its creature type. Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been consecrated or desecrated, as with the {@spell Hallow} spell.

classFeature.name: Paladin Subclass
entries: You gain a Paladin subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Paladin levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Paladin level or lower.

entries.name: Breaking Your Oath
entries: A Paladin tries to hold to the highest standards of conduct, but even the most dedicated are fallible. Sometimes a Paladin transgresses their oath.
A Paladin who has broken a vow typically seeks absolution, spending an all-night vigil as a sign of penitence or undertaking a fast. After a rite of forgiveness, the Paladin starts fresh.
If your Paladin unrepentantly violates their oath, talk to your DM. Your Paladin should probably take a more appropriate subclass or even abandon the class and adopt another one.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Paladin levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Faithful Steed
entries: You can call on the aid of an otherworldly steed. You always have the {@spell Find Steed} spell prepared.
You can also cast the spell once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

classFeature.name: Aura of Protection
entries: You radiate a protective, unseeable aura in a 10-foot {@rule Emanation} that originates from you. The aura is inactive while you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.
You and your allies in the aura gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum bonus of +1).
If another Paladin is present, a creature can benefit from only one Aura of Protection at a time; the creature chooses which aura while in them.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Paladin Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} Feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Abjure Foes
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can expend one use of this class's Channel Divinity to overwhelm foes with awe. As you present your {@item Holy Symbol} or weapon, you can target a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature) that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. While {@condition Frightened} in this way, a target can do only one of the following on its turns: move, take an action, or take a {@rule Bonus Action}.

classFeature.name: Aura of Courage
entries: You and your allies have {@rule Immunity} to the {@condition Frightened} condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a {@condition Frightened} ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.

classFeature.name: Radiant Strikes
entries: Your strikes now carry supernatural power. When you hit a target with an attack roll using a Melee weapon or an {@rule Unarmed Strike}, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} Feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Restoring Touch
entries: When you use Lay On Hands on a creature, you can also remove one or more of the following conditions from the creature: {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, or {@condition Stunned}. You must expend 5 Hit Points from the healing pool of Lay On Hands for each of these conditions you remove; those points don't also restore Hit Points to the creature.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Paladin Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} Feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Aura Expansion
entries: Your Aura of Protection is now a 30-foot {@rule Emanation}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@epic-boon Epic Boon} or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. {@epic-boon Boon of Truesight} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Paladin Subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Ancients
entries: {@i Preserve Life and Light in the World}

The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the first elves. Paladins who swear this oath cherish the light; they love the beautiful and life-giving things of the world more than any principles of honor, courage, and justice. They often adorn their armor and clothing with images of growing things—leaves, antlers, or flowers—to reflect their commitment to preserving life and light.
These paladins share the following tenets:

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Ancients Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Ancients Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Wrath
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to conjure spectral vines around nearby creatures. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of yourself must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained} condition for 1 minute. A {@condition Restrained} creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warding
entries: Ancient magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms an eldritch ward, blunting energy from beyond the Material Plane; you and your allies have {@rule Resistance} to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage while in your Aura of Protection.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Sentinel
entries: When you are reduced to 0 Hit Points and not killed outright, you can drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to three times your Paladin level. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
Additionally, you can't be aged magically, and you cease visibly aging.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Champion
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with primal power, granting the benefits below for 1 minute or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Diminish Defiance
entries: Enemies in the aura have {@rule Disadvantage} on saving throws against your spells and Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 Hit Points.

entries.name: Swift Spells
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that has a casting time of an action, you can cast it using a {@rule Bonus Action} instead.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Devotion
entries: {@i Uphold the Ideals of Justice and Order}

The Oath of Devotion binds Paladins to the ideals of justice and order. These Paladins meet the archetype of the knight in shining armor. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some—for better or worse—hold the rest of the world to the same standards.

Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their gods' tenets as the measure of personal devotion. Others hold angels as their ideals and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.
These paladins share the following tenets:

items: Let your word be your promise.
Protect the weak and never fear to act.
Let your honorable deeds be an example.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Devotion Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Devotion Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of Devotion Spells
rows: {@spell Protection from Evil And Good}, {@spell Shield of Faith}
{@spell Freedom of Movement}, {@spell Guardian of Faith}

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Weapon
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to imbue one Melee weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 10 minutes or until you use this feature again, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls you make with that weapon (minimum bonus of +1), and each time you hit with it, you cause it to deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage.
The weapon also emits {@rule Bright Light} in a 20-foot radius and {@rule Dim Light} 20 feet beyond that.
You can end this effect early (no action required). This effect also ends if you aren't carrying the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Devotion
entries: You and your allies have {@rule Immunity} to the {@condition Charmed} condition while in your Aura of Protection. If a {@condition Charmed} ally enters the aura, that condition has no effect on that ally while there.

subclassFeature.name: Smite of Protection
entries: Your magical smite now radiates protective energy. Whenever you cast {@spell Divine Smite}, you and your allies have {@rule Cover|Half Cover} while in your Aura of Protection. The aura has this benefit until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Nimbus
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can imbue your Aura of Protection with holy power, granting the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Holy Ward
entries: You have {@rule Advantage} on any saving throw you are forced to make by a Fiend or an Undead.

entries.name: Radiant Damage
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn in the aura, that creature takes Radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier plus your {@rule Proficiency} Bonus.

entries.name: Sunlight
entries: The aura is filled with {@rule Bright Light} that is sunlight.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Glory
entries: {@i Strive for the Heights of Heroism}

Paladins who take the Oath of Glory believe they and their companions are destined to achieve glory through deeds of heroism. They train diligently and encourage their companions, so they're all ready when destiny calls.
These paladins share the following tenets:

items: Endeavor to be known by your deeds.
Inspire others to strive for glory.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Glory Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Glory Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Smite
entries: Immediately after you cast {@spell Divine Smite}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity and distribute {@rule Temporary Hit Points} to creatures of your choice within 30 feet of yourself, which can include you. The total number of {@rule Temporary Hit Points} equals 2d8 plus your Paladin level, divided among the chosen creatures however you like.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Athlete
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to augment your athleticism. For 1 hour, you have {@rule Advantage} on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks, and the distance of your Long and High Jumps increases by 10 feet (this extra distance costs movement as normal).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Alacricity
entries: Your Speed increases by 10 feet.
In addition, whenever an ally enters your Aura of Protection for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, the ally's {@rule Speed} increases by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Defense
entries: You can turn defense into a sudden strike. When you or another creature you can see within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to grant a bonus to the target's AC against that attack, potentially causing it to miss. The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). If the attack misses, you can make one attack with a weapon against the attacker as part of this {@rule Reaction} if the attacker is within your weapon's range.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

subclassFeature.name: Living Legend
entries: You can empower yourself with the legends—whether true or exaggerated—of your great deeds. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Charismatic
entries: You are blessed with an otherworldly presence and have {@rule Advantage} on all Charisma checks.

entries.name: Saving Throw Reroll
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to reroll it. You must use this new roll.

entries.name: Unerring Strike
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make an attack roll with a weapon and miss, you can cause that attack to hit instead.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Vengeance
entries: {@i Punish Evildoers at Any Cost}

The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed grievously evil acts. When evil armies slaughter helpless villagers, when a tyrant defies the will of the gods, when a thieves' guild grows too violent, when a dragon rampages through the countryside—at times like these, paladins arise and swear an Oath of Vengeance to set right what has gone wrong.
These paladins share the following tenets:

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Vengeance Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Vengeance Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Vow of Enmity
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You have {@rule Advantage} on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.
If the creature drops to 0 Hit Points before the vow ends, you can transfer the vow to a different creature within 30 feet of yourself (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Avenger
entries: Your supernatural focus helps you close off a foe's retreat. When you hit a creature with an {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}, you can reduce the creature's Speed to 0 until the end of the current turn. You can then move up to half your Speed as part of the same Reaction. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|Opportunity Attacks}.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of Vengeance
entries: Immediately after a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity hits or misses with an attack roll, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to make a melee attack against that creature if it's within range.

subclassFeature.name: Avenging Angel
entries: As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you gain the benefits below for 10 minutes or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@rule Long Rest}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Flight
entries: You sprout spectral wings on your back, have a {@rule Fly Speed} of 60 feet, and can hover.

entries.name: Frightful Aura
entries: Whenever an enemy starts its turn in your Aura of Protection, that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. {@action Attack} rolls against the {@condition Frightened} creature have {@rule Advantage}.

fluff.name: Ranger
entries: Versatile fighters defined by their stance as a bastion protecting civilization from encroaching danger. Rangers use their martial powers, ingenuity, and limited nature magic to survive at any costs.

{@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Studded Leather Armor}, {@item Scimitar}, {@item Shortsword}, {@item Longbow}, {@item Arrows (20)|20 Arrows}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Druidic Focus} ({@item sprig of mistletoe}), {@item Explorer's Pack}, and 7 GP; or (B) 150 GP

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have learned to channel the magical essence of nature to cast spells. The information below details how you use those rules with Ranger spells, which appear in the {@spells ?spell-class-filter=ranger|Ranger spell list}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Ranger Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Ranger spells. {@spell Cure Wounds} and {@spell Ensnaring Strike} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Ranger levels, as shown in the Spells column of the Ranger Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Ranger spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Ranger Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 5 Ranger, your list of prepared spells can include six Ranger spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Ranger feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Ranger spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can replace one spell on your list with another Ranger spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Ranger spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item Druidic Focus} as a {@rule Spellcasting Focus} for your Ranger spells.

classFeature.name: Favored Enemy
entries: You always have the {@spell Hunter's Mark} spell prepared. You can cast it twice without expending a spell slot, and you regain all expended uses of this ability when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
The number of times you can cast the spell without a spell slot increases when you reach certain Ranger levels, as shown in the Favored {@rule Enemy} column of the Ranger Features table.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Longbow|Longbows} and {@item Shortsword|Shortswords}.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of {@item Scimitar|Scimitars} and {@item Longsword|Longswords}.

classFeature.name: Deft Explorer
entries: Thanks to your travels, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@rule Expertise}. You gain {@rule Expertise} in that skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You know two languages of your choice.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You gain a Fighting Style option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ranger Subclass
entries: You gain a Ranger subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Ranger levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Ranger level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Ranger levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Roving
entries: Your {@rule Speed} increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing Heavy armor. You also have a {@rule Climb Speed} and a {@rule Swim Speed} equal to your {@rule Speed}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: Choose two of your skill proficiencies with which you lack {@rule Expertise}. You gain {@rule Expertise} in those skills.

classFeature.name: Tireless
entries: Primal forces now help fuel you on your journeys, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Temporary Hit Points
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can give yourself a number of {@rule Temporary Hit Points} equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Decrease Exhaustion
entries: Whenever you finish a {@rule Short Rest}, your {@condition Exhaustion} level, if any, decreases by 1.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: Taking damage can't break your {@status Concentration} on Hunter's Mark.

classFeature.name: Nature's Veil
entries: You invoke spirits of nature to magically hide yourself. As a {@rule Bonus Action}, you can give yourself the {@condition Invisible} condition until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Ranger Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement} feat or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Precise Hunter
entries: You have {@rule Advantage} on attack rolls against the creature currently marked by your Hunter's Mark.

classFeature.name: Feral Senses
entries: Your connection to the forces of nature grants you {@sense Blindsight} with a range of 30 feet.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@epic-boon Epic Boon} or another {@feat feat} of your choice for which you qualify. {@epic-boon Boon of Dimensional Travel} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Foe Slayer
entries: The damage die of your Hunter's Mark is a d10 rather than a d6.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Master
entries: {@i Bond with a Primal Beast}
A Beast Master forms a mystical bond with a special animal, drawing on primal magic and a deep connection to the natural world.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Companion
entries: You magically summon a primal beast, which draws strength from your bond with nature. Choose its stat block: {@creature Beast of the Land}, {@creature Beast of the Sea}, or {@creature Beast of the Sky}. You also determine the kind of animal it is, choosing a kind appropriate for the stat block. Whatever beast you choose, it bears primal markings indicating its supernatural origin.
The beast is Friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It vanishes if you die.

entries.name: The Beast in Combat
entries: In combat, the beast acts during your turn. It can move and use its {@rule Reaction} on its own, but the only action it takes is the {@action Dodge} action unless you take a {@rule Bonus Action} to command it to take an action in its stat block or some other action. You can also sacrifice one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action to command the beast to take the Beast's Strike action. If you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition, the beast acts on its own and isn't limited to the {@action Dodge} action.

entries.name: Restoring or Replacing the Beast
entries: If the beast has died within the last hour, you can take a {@action Magic} action to touch it and expend a spell slot. The beast returns to life after 1 minute with all its Hit Points restored.

Whenever you finish a {@rule Long Rest}, you can summon a different primal beast, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. You choose its stat block and appearance. If you already have a beast from this feature, the old one vanishes when the new one appears.

subclassFeature.name: Exceptional Training
entries: When you take a {@rule Bonus Action} to command your Primal Companion beast to take an action, you can also command it to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Dodge}, or {@action Help} action using its {@rule Bonus Action}.
In addition, whenever it hits with an attack roll and deals damage, it can deal your choice of Force damage or its normal damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Fury
entries: When you command your Primal Companion beast to take the Beast's Strike action, the beast can use it twice.
In addition, the first time each turn it hits a creature under the effect of your {@spell Hunter's Mark} spell, the beast deals extra Force damage equal to the bonus damage of that spell.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: When you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your Primal Companion beast with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Wanderer
entries: {@i Wield Fey Mirth and Fury}

A fey mystique surrounds you, thanks to the boon of an archfey or a location in the Feywild that transformed you. However you gained fey magic, you are now a Fey Wanderer. Your joyful laughter brightens the hearts of the downtrodden, and your martial prowess strikes terror in your foes, for great is the mirth of the fey and dreadful is their fury.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Strikes
entries: You can augment your weapon strikes with mind-scarring magic drawn from the murky hollows of the Feywild. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage to the target, which can take this extra damage only once per turn. The extra damage increases to 1d10 when you reach Ranger level 11.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Wanderer Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Fey Wanderer Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.
You also possess a fey blessing. Choose it from the Feywild Gifts table or determine it randomly.

entries.caption: Feywild Gifts
rows: Illusory butterflies flutter around you while you take a Short or Long Rest.
Flowers bloom from your hair each dawn.
You faintly smell of cinnamon, lavender, nutmeg, or another comforting herb or spice.
Your shadow dances while no one is looking directly at it.
Horns or antlers sprout from your head.
Your skin and hair change color each dawn.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Glamour
entries: Whenever you make a Charisma check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
You also gain proficiency in one of these skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

subclassFeature.name: Beguiling Twist
entries: The magic of the Feywild guards your mind. You have {@rule Advantage} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition.

In addition, whenever you or a creature you can see within 120 feet of you succeeds on a saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} condition, you can take a {@rule Reaction} to force a different creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom save against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is {@condition Charmed} or {@condition Frightened} (your choice) for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Reinforcements
entries: You can cast {@spell Summon Fey} without a Material component. You can also cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.
Whenever you start casting the spell, you can modify it so that it doesn't require {@status Concentration}. If you do so, the spell's duration becomes 1 minute for that casting.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Wanderer
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step} without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

In addition, whenever you cast {@spell Misty Step}, you can bring along one willing creature you can see within 5 feet of yourself. That creature teleports to an unoccupied space of your choice within 5 feet of your destination space.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker
entries: {@i Draw on Shadow Magic to Fight Your Foes}
Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, wielding magic drawn from the Shadowfell to combat enemies that lurk in darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Gloom Stalker Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Gloom Stalker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Ambusher
entries: You have mastered the art of creating fearsome ambushes, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Ambusher's Leap
entries: At the start of your first turn of each combat, your {@rule Speed} increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.

entries.name: Frighten
entries: When you attack a creature and hit it with a weapon, you can deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage. You can use this benefit only once per turn, you can use it a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@rule Long Rest}.

entries.name: Initiative Bonus
entries: When you roll {@rule Initiative}, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Sight
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision} when you gain this feature, its range increases by 60 feet.

You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on {@sense Darkvision}.
